meanings.definition: The face or countenance of a person.
meanings.sent1: She had a smile on her panim.
meanings.sent2: His panim showed surprise when he saw the cake.
meanings.sent3: The clown painted a funny face on his panim.
meanings.sent4: Her panim lit up with joy as she opened the gift.
meanings.sent5: The panim of the statue looked so lifelike.

meanings.definition: The front part of the head.
meanings.sent1: The hat covered his panim from the sun.
meanings.sent2: She gently kissed his panim before saying goodbye.
meanings.sent3: The baby's tiny hands reached for his own panim.
meanings.sent4: The panim of the mountain was covered in snow.
meanings.sent5: The panim of the ship was beautifully carved.

meanings.definition: The surface of a clock or watch that displays the time.
meanings.sent1: The panim of the clock showed it was time for lunch.
meanings.sent2: He glanced at the panim of his watch during the meeting.
meanings.sent3: The cat knocked the clock off the table, breaking its panim.
meanings.sent4: The panim of the antique watch was intricately designed.
meanings.sent5: The panim of the digital clock glowed in the dark.

meanings.definition: The appearance or expression of a person.
meanings.sent1: His tired panim showed he had a long day.
meanings.sent2: She tried to hide her panim of disappointment.
meanings.sent3: The actor's exaggerated panim made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The panim of the painting captured her beauty perfectly.
meanings.sent5: The panim of the old man held a lifetime of stories.
